intro: Mosla lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf mosla, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Mosla lanceolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
